climbs.name: Watchtower
climbs.fa: B. Scott, R. D. Pascoe, C. Tirrell

content.description: Layback up a big flake to the 2nd bolt. Continuous climbing on big fun holds takes you to the top of the watchtower and a final slab to the anchor.
content.location: This is on the left side of the Colors Crag.

content.description:
This is a fun link-up that adds a little more pump to

Castle Magic

.

Start by climbing most of

Machine Gun

to the 8th bolt and a rest in a groove. Step left here, and clip the 5th bolt on

Castle Magic

before engaging the first of several excellent cruxes up the headwall.
content.location: It is in the center of the crag.

content.description: Climb a left-facing corner feature past some pinches and layback features (beware of choss). Pumpy terrain leads over a short bulge to a stance in a groove. Move up and right over the last bulge through some sweet finger-locks to the chains.
content.location: This is in the center at the cliff following an arching crack/seam system.

content.description: Climb an easy intro slab to the first bolt. From here, a series of blocky jugs and featured cracks leads to a stance on top of a large block feature. A final tricky stand-up move brings you to the chains.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the Colors Crag.
This is in the center of the cliff following the long, black streak.

content.description: Game Trail is an interesting hand to fist-sized crack splitting a low angle slab. Begin in a lieback feature, and then move right into the hand crack.
content.location: Set apart from the other routes, Game Trail can be accessed by going downhill to the left at the saddle instead of going to the right where the other routes are located.

content.description: Climb the right-arching crack past a bolt at the start. A high crux guards the chains on the redpoint.
content.location: This is on the right side of the cliff following the obvious, arching crack feature.

content.description: A series of layback jugs takes you to crimpy terrain past the 3rd bolt. A punchy move gets you through the overhang and up to the big ledge. A final layback section with technical footwork takes you up the final headwall to the chains.
content.location: This is just left of center at the Colors Crag.

content.description:
Originally a mixed route, this route is now fully bolted by the FA.

Start with some juggy laybacks up a dihedral feature past 5 bolts. After the corner ends enter the intimidating tan headwall past 3 more bolts. Pinches, knobs, crimps and excellent rock take you through a lot of committing 5.12 climbing to reach the chains.
content.location: This is left of center at Colors Crag climbing up the right-facing corner to the tan headwall.

content.description: Ramble up broken terrain (4 bolts) to gain the ledge at the base of the crack proper, then continue up hand/fist crack for 60 feet to the anchor.
content.location:
Are You Experienced? is left of

Watchtower

.
